gurmukhi: sIs pry kit bIrn ky DrnI KVgyS su sIs Chy hY ]mwnhu sRaun srovr mY isr S`qRn kMj sy mUMd rhy hY ]1430]
transliteration: Sees Dare Kattee Bderan Ke Dharnikhadgesh Su Sees Chahe Haai|| Maanoh Sraoun Darovar Mai Sir Shattran Kanj Se Moondd Rahe Hai||1430||
translation: The heads of the warriors are being torn with the blows of Kharag Singh like the lotus-heats of the enemy torn in the tank of blood.1430.

gurmukhi: qik JUJ isMG ko KVg sI KVg lIXo kir kop ]hnXo qbY isr S`qR ko jn dInI As Ep ]1431]
transliteration: Tak(i) Jhoojh Singh Ko Khadag Sikhadag Leeyo Kar(i) Kop|| Hanyo Tabai Sir Shattrako Jan Deenias Op||1431||
translation: Seeing the dagger of Jujhan Singh, Kharag Singh took his sword in his hand and like lightning, he struck it on the head of the enemy and killed him.1431.

gurmukhi: puin isMG juJwr mhw rn mY lir kY mir kY sur lok ibhwrXo ]sYn ijqo iqh sMg huqo qb hI As lY niRp mwr ibdwrXo ]
transliteration: Poun(i) Singh Jjujhaar Mahaa Ran Mai Lar(i) Kai Mar(i) Kai Sur Lok Bihdaryo|| Sain Jito Tih San Houto Tab Hias Lai Nrip Maar Biddaryo||
translation: In this way in this great war, Jujhar Singh also, went to heaven while fighting and the army which was with him, the king (Kharag Singh) was torn into fragments;

gurmukhi: jyqy rhy su Bjy rn qy iknhUM nhI lwj kI Er inhwrXo ]mwnhu dMf lIey kr mY jm ky sm BUm mhw As DwrXo ]1432]
transliteration: Jete Rahe Su Bhaje Ran Te Kinhoon Nahilaaj Kior Nihdaryo|| Maanoh Dand Leee Kar Mai Jam Ke Sam Bhoop Mahaa As Dhdaryo||1432||
translation: Those who survived, without caring for their honour and custom fled away; they saw in the king Kharag Singh Yama, carrying the death-sentence in his hand.1432.

gurmukhi: KVg isMG sru Dnu ghXo iknhU rihXo n DIr ]clo iqAwgkY rn rQI mhwNrQI blbIr ]1433]
transliteration: Khadag Singh Sar(u) Dhan(u) Gadyo Kinhoo Rahiyo Na Dheer|| Chale Tiaag-kai Ran Rathimahaanrathibalbeer||1433||
translation: When Kharag Singh caught hold of his bow and arrows in his hands then all of them lost patience and all the chieftains and mighty warriors left the war-arena.1433.

gurmukhi: jb BwjI jwdv cmUM kiRSn iblokI nYn ]swqk isau hir XO kihXo qum Dwvhu lY sYn ]1434]
transliteration: Jab Bhaajijaadav Chamoond Krishan Bilokinain|| Saatak Sio Har(i) You Kahiyo Toum Dhaavoh Lai Sain||1434||
translation: When Krishna saw the Yadava army running away, then calling Satyak towards him, he said, “Go with your army.”1434.

gurmukhi: swqk Aau brmw kiRq aUDv sRI muslI kr mY hlu lY ]bsudyv qy Awidk bIr ijqy iqh Awgy kIXo bl kau dlu dY ]
transliteration: Saatak Au Barmaa Krit Oodhav Srimouslikar Mai Hal(u) Lai|| Basudev Te Aadik Beer Jite Tih Aage Keeyo Bal Kau Dal(u) Dai||
translation: He sent all his great warriors including Satyak, Krat Verma, Udhava, Balram, Vasudev etc. to the front,

gurmukhi: sBhU niRp aUpir bwnn biRSt krI mn mY qik kY Klu CY ]surrwj pTy igr goDn pY irs myG mno brKY blu kY ]1435]
transliteration: Sabh-hoo Nrip Oopar(i) Baanan Brishat Kariman Mai Tak(i) Kai Khal(u) Chhai|| Sur-raaj Pathe Gir Godhan Pai Ris Megh Mano Barkhai Bal(u) Kai||1435||
translation: And they all showed so many arrows in order to destroy Kharag Singh like powerful clouds sent by Indra for bursting into rain on the Goverdhan mountain.1435.

gurmukhi: sr jwl krwl sBY sih kY gih kY bhuro Dn bwn clwey ]bwj kry sBhUM ky Gwiel sUq sBY iqn ky rn Gwey ]
transliteration: Sar Jaal Karaal Sabhai Sah(i) Kai Gih Kai Bahuro Dhan Baan Chadhaae|| Baaj Dare Sabh-hoon Ke Ghaail Soot Sabhai Tin Ke Ran Ghaae||
translation: The king enduring the terrible rain of arrows also discharged arrows from his side; he wounded the horse of all the kings and killed all their charioteers;
